CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper July 13, 1957, pg. 1, reads: "At Last! - Police patrol cars began operating on an integrated basis at East Liberty Police Station on July 2. Lieut. William R. Bradnick, right, gives an order to an integrated crew composed of Patrolman Charles Tarrant, left, and Edward Chadwicz, center. Patrolman Richard Campbell also is assigned to the integrated car. The move is the latest step in a plan to integrate the entire Pittsburgh police force. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Police officers Charles Tarrant, Edward Chadwicz, and Lieut. William R. Bradnick standing beside City of Pittsburgh police car no. 6-3, near East Liberty police station near intersection of Broad Street, East Liberty
